title: [Large-Scale] Knowledge Management-Based Integrated Mathematics Learning Object Project

context.prior_knowledge: Grasp of basic mathematical concepts and experience with digital learning tools
context.additional_context: Learners experience creating, evaluating, and integrating reusable digital learning objects to solve real-world math problems, contributing to an organized knowledge-sharing system through application of knowledge management lifecycle models

learning_goals: Learners design and develop three or more reusable learning objects for mathematical problem-solving.

According to the five stages of the knowledge management lifecycle (creation-evaluation-classification-storage-utilization), learners classify and store ten math learning objects (videos, PDFs, quizzes) meeting over 80% of the evaluation rubric criteria (accuracy, systematicity, applicability), and manage them in a searchable format using a metadata tagging system.

Collaborating with 2â€“3 peer learners, learners produce a 10-minute video or presentation material explaining math concepts (e.g., functions, calculus, statistics) and achieve over 4 points (on a 5-point scale) in at least two of three peer evaluation rubric categories (clarity, accuracy, creativity).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
